Description: A small fragment of natural and pink/purple coloured wool textile (fabric type F) used as a wrapping. The weave is plain and weft-predominant and very loosely spun. The spinning direction of warp and weft is 's'. The thread count is warp 8 per10mm and weft 20 per10mm. The textile is decorated with a purple/pink band 135mm wide with natural bands on either side.
Acquisition name: Donated by: Dr William Yewdale Adams
Donated by: W S Webb Museum of Anthropology (University of Kentucky)
Additional IDs: Excavation/small finds number: 93.2.51B (excavation object cat. no.)
